title: Automatic Plotting of Many Graphs
text: package aims make network visualisation easier, succinct, consistent. Visualisation key part research process, initial exploration data analysis results presentation findings publications. However, often tedious time-consuming task. Trying wrangle consistent style publication presentation can frustrating requires lot code. number excellent packages network analysis R, face several following challenges comes visualisation: defaults often sensible different types networks customisation can sometimes difficult require multiple lines code even produce graph plot require multiple lines code produce graph plot styled suitable publication presentation style code needs repeated every time graph plot produced consistent style maintained defaults syntax different different packages, workflow using multiple packages must adapt multiple syntaxes different visual defaults can frustrate interpretation, potentially invites errors comparing plots different packages plotting methods available networks network-related results others autograph aims solve problems providing automatic graph drawing networks manynet formats, automatic plotting results {stocnet} packages, including migraph, RSiena, {MoNAn}, . need install package (loading last make sure plotting methods default), use set_stocnet_theme() () set preferred theme, use graphr() graph networks, plot() plot results. ’s !

title: Automatic Plotting of Many Graphs
text: autograph includes three one-line graphing functions sensible defaults based network’s properties. First, graphr() used graph networks manynet formats. builds upon manynet, can graph networks manynet formats, including network, igraph, sna, tidygraph, . Second, includes sensible defaults researchers can view network’s structure distribution quickly minimum fuss. Compare output autograph similar default igraph:  igraph requires bipartite layout specified, cumbersome node size defaults smallest graphs, labels also often need resizing adjustment avoid overlap. Getting default plot look good can take lot trial error, time. contrast, graphr() recognises network two-mode uses bipartite layout default. also recognises network contains names nodes prints vertically legible layout. ‘clever’ features include automatic node sizing .

title: Automatic Plotting of Many Graphs
text: graphr()’s adjustments can overridden, however… Changing size colors nodes ties easy specifying function’s relevant argument replacement, e.g. node_color = "darkblue" node_size = 6, indicating attribute inherit information, e.g. node_color = "Office" node_size = "Seniority".  Legends added default node tie aesthetics mapped attributes, can removed show_legend = FALSE. Since autograph builds upon ggplot2, titles, subtitles , plotting, axis labels can added easily, elements (e.g. font size) can tweaked particular output.

title: Automatic Plotting of Many Graphs
text: graphr() can use layout algorithms offered packages igraph, ggraph, graphlayouts. autograph also offers additional layout algorithms visualising partitions horizontally, vertically, concentrically, conforming configurational coordinates, snapping layouts grid.

title: Automatic Plotting of Many Graphs
text: second graph drawing function included, graphs(), used graph multiple networks together. can useful ego networks network panels. patchwork used help arrange individual plots together, used throughout package help arrange plots together informatively.

title: Automatic Plotting of Many Graphs
text: third graph drawing function, grapht(), used visualise dynamic networks. uses gganimate gifski create gif visualises network changes time. really couldn’t easier.

title: Automatic Plotting of Many Graphs
text: Since network analysis involves just drawing graphs, autograph also provides function plotting results analysis modelling networks. keep things simple, users need remember single, generic function: plot(). Method dispatching takes care rest, can concentrate exploring interpreting results. examples, using goodness--fit results fitting SAOM RSiena ERGM ergm. (Note neither data model similar; just illustrative purposes.)

title: Automatic Plotting of Many Graphs
text: Note plots, colour scheme fonts used. can easily changed though. autograph includes number themes can used style graphs plots consistently. easy set theme. Just type stocnet_theme() see theme currently set, get list available themes. enter chosen theme name function set . plots created using autograph functions use theme, change .   range institutional topical themes available, including default, bw, crisp, neon, iheid, ethz, uzh, rug, unibe, oxf, unige, cmu, rainbow, way. institution organisation included like , please just raise issue Github, along link corporate branding style guide available, attempt add next opportunity. sum, lot clever defaults customisation available, takes three simple functions
code: stocnet_theme() (plot(node_degree(ison_karateka)) +  plot(tie_betweenness(ison_karateka)))/ (plot(node_in_regular(ison_southern_women, "e")) +  plot(as_matrix(ison_southern_women),      membership = node_in_regular(ison_southern_women, "e"))) stocnet_theme("ethz") (plot(node_degree(ison_karateka)) +  plot(tie_betweenness(ison_karateka)))/ (plot(node_in_regular(ison_southern_women, "e")) +  plot(as_matrix(ison_southern_women),      membership = node_in_regular(ison_southern_women, "e")))

title: Automatic Plotting of Many Graphs
text: easiest way install latest stable version autograph via CRAN. Simply open R console enter: install.packages('autograph') library(autograph) load package make data tutorials (see ) contained within package available.

title: Automatic Plotting of Many Graphs
text: latest development version, slightly earlier access new features testing, may wish download install binaries Github install source locally. latest binary releases major OSes – Windows, Mac, Linux – can found . Download appropriate binary operating system, install using adapted version following commands: Windows: install.packages("~/Downloads/autograph_winOS.zip", repos = NULL) Mac: install.packages("~/Downloads/autograph_macOS.tgz", repos = NULL) Unix: install.packages("~/Downloads/autograph_linuxOS.tar.gz", repos = NULL) install source latest main version autograph Github, please install remotes package CRAN : latest stable version: remotes::install_github("stocnet/autograph") latest development version: remotes::install_github("stocnet/autograph@develop")

what: Layouts for snapping layouts to a grid — depth_first_recursive_search
title: Layouts for snapping layouts to a grid — depth_first_recursive_search
text: function uses approximate pattern matching redistribute coarse layouts square grid points, preserving topological relationships among nodes (see Inoue et al. 2012).

title: Layouts for snapping layouts to a grid — depth_first_recursive_search
code: depth_first_recursive_search(layout)

title: Layouts for snapping layouts to a grid — depth_first_recursive_search
text: Inoue, Kentaro, Shinichi Shimozono, Hideaki Yoshida, Hiroyuki Kurata. 2012. “Application Approximate Pattern Matching Two Dimensional Spaces Grid Layout Biochemical Network Maps” edited J. Bourdon. PLoS ONE 7(6):e37739. doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0037739 .

what: Layout algorithms based on bi- or other partitions — layout_partition
title: Layout algorithms based on bi- or other partitions — layout_partition
text: algorithms layout networks based two partitions, recommended use graphr() {ggraph}. Note layout algorithms use {Rgraphviz}, package available Bioconductor. first need downloaded using BiocManager::install("Rgraphviz"). already installed, prompt first time functions used though. "hierarchy" layout layers first node set along bottom, second node set along top, sequenced spaced necessary minimise edge overlap. "alluvial" layout similar "hierarchy", places successive layers horizontally rather vertically. "railway" layout similar "hierarchy", nodes aligned across layers. "ladder" layout similar "railway", places successive layers horizontally rather vertically. "concentric" layout places "hierarchy" layout around circle, successive layers appearing concentric circles. "multilevel" layout places successive layers multiple levels. "lineage" layout ranks nodes Y axis according values.

title: Layout algorithms based on bi- or other partitions — layout_partition
code: layout_concentric(   .data,   membership,   radius = NULL,   order.by = NULL,   circular = FALSE,   times = 1000 )  layout_tbl_graph_concentric(   .data,   membership,   radius = NULL,   order.by = NULL,   circular = FALSE,   times = 1000 )  layout_multilevel(.data, level, circular = FALSE)  layout_tbl_graph_multilevel(.data, level, circular = FALSE)  layout_lineage(.data, rank, circular = FALSE)  layout_tbl_graph_lineage(.data, rank, circular = FALSE)  layout_hierarchy(.data, center = NULL, circular = FALSE, times = 1000)  layout_tbl_graph_hierarchy(   .data,   center = NULL,   circular = FALSE,   times = 1000 )  layout_alluvial(.data, circular = FALSE, times = 1000)  layout_tbl_graph_alluvial(.data, circular = FALSE, times = 1000)  layout_railway(.data, circular = FALSE, times = 1000)  layout_tbl_graph_railway(.data, circular = FALSE, times = 1000)  layout_ladder(.data, circular = FALSE, times = 1000)  layout_tbl_graph_ladder(.data, circular = FALSE, times = 1000)

title: Layout algorithms based on bi- or other partitions — layout_partition
text: Diego Diez, Andrew P. Hutchins Diego Miranda-Saavedra. 2014. "Systematic identification transcriptional regulatory modules protein-protein interaction networks". Nucleic Acids Research, 42 (1) e6.

title: Layout algorithms based on bi- or other partitions — layout_partition
text: .data {manynet} compatible network data. membership node attribute vector draw concentric circles "concentric" layout. radius vector radii concentric circles located "concentric" layout. default equal placement around empty centre, unless one (core) single node, case node occupies centre graph. order.attribute label indicating (decreasing) order nodes around circles "concentric" layout. default ordering given bipartite placement reduces number edge crossings. circular layout transformed radial representation. possible layouts. Defaults FALSE. times Maximum number iterations, appropriate level node attribute vector hierarchically order levels "multilevel" layout. rank numerical node attribute place nodes Y axis according values "lineage" layout. center split "hierarchical" layouts declaring "center" argument "events", "actors", declaring node name hierarchy layout. Defaults NULL.

title: Layout algorithms based on bi- or other partitions — layout_partition

text: Valence-based layout

title: Valence-based layout — layout_valence
code: layout_valence(   .data,   times = 500,   center = NULL,   circular = FALSE,   repulsion_coef = 1,   attraction_coef = 0.05 )  layout_tbl_graph_valence(   .data,   times = 500,   center = NULL,   circular = FALSE,   repulsion_coef = 1,   attraction_coef = 0.05 )

title: Valence-based layout — layout_valence
text: .data {manynet} compatible network data. times Integer sweeps algorithm pass . default 4. center, circular Extra parameters required {tidygraph} compatibility. repulsion_coef Coefficient global repulsion force. Default 1. attraction_coef Coefficient edge-based attraction/repulsion force. Default 0.05.

title: Valence-based layout — layout_valence
code: edges <- data.frame(   from = c("A", "B", "C", "D"),   to   = c("B", "C", "D", "A"),   weight = c(2, 3, 1, 4),   sign = c(1, -1, 1, -1)  # 1 = positive, -1 = negative   ) graphr(as_igraph(edges), layout="valence")

title: Plotting goodness-of-fit results — plot_gof
text: plot methods plot goodness fit objects created using RSiena::sienaGOF(), MoNAn::monanGOF(), 'ergm' package's gof() function. Internally, GOF object translated common class (ag_gof), plot method ensure consistent look feel. expected users create ag_gof class objects . plot shows violin plot distribution statistics simulations, boxplot inside violin show interquartile range, dashed lines connecting 5th 95th percentiles. boxplot also shows outliers crosses. observed statistics shown points connected line. observed statistics also labelled value. p-value available (case RSiena::sienaGOF()), shown beneath x-axis.

title: Plotting goodness-of-fit results — plot_gof
code: # S3 method for class 'ag_gof' plot(x, ...)  # S3 method for class 'gof.stats.monan' plot(x, cumulative = FALSE, ...)  # S3 method for class 'sienaGOF' plot(x, cumulative = FALSE, ...)  # S3 method for class 'gof.ergm' plot(x, cumulative = FALSE, statistic = c("deg", "espart", "dist"), ...)

title: Plotting goodness-of-fit results — plot_gof
text: x object class "sienaGOF", "gof.stats.monan", "gof.ergm". ... parameters passed plotting function, example main = "Title" different title default. cumulative Logical, indicating whether statistics plotted cumulatively (default FALSE). typically treated sienaGOF() {RSiena}, treated within plotting function {MoNAn} 'ergm'. statistic Character, indicating statistic plot. Since 'ergm' package GOFs include goodness fit multiple statistics, user must specify statistic plot. Options "deg" (degree distribution), "espart" (edgewise shared partners), "dist" (geodesic distance). default "deg".

title: Plotting goodness-of-fit results — plot_gof
text: violin plot showing distribution statistics simulations line joining points showing observed statistics.

title: Plotting goodness-of-fit results — plot_gof
text: Since plots methods {autograph}, plots automatically themed according current theme set using stocnet_theme(). function uses highlight colour defined current theme highlight observed statistics. function also uses base colour defined current theme draw violin box plots. however completely customisable. title automatically generated graph informative, can customised specifying main argument plotting function, added fact using {ggplot2} functions ggtitle() labs(). user can choose whether plot statistics cumulatively . typically handled within RSiena::sienaGOF(), MoNAn::monanGOF() 'ergm' package's gof() function cumulative option handled . default plot non-cumulative statistics. non-cumulative statistics often interpretable, cumulative statistics can obtained setting cumulative = TRUE. function also checks whether statistics zero variance across simulations, , statistics plotted, message user indicating statistics omitted. Note methods overwrite plot methods classes may provided original packages. may receive warning console loading package. Please load {autograph} packages ensure plotting methods included package used, specify package calling plotting method directly, e.g., autograph:::plot.sienaGOF(res_siena_gof).

title: Plotting goodness-of-fit results — plot_gof
text: Hintze, J. L. Nelson, R. D. 1998. "Violin plots: box plot-density trace synergism". American Statistician, 52:181–184. doi:10.1080/00031305.1998.10480559

title: Plotting goodness-of-fit results — plot_gof
code: plot(monan_gof)  plot(siena_gof, cumulative = TRUE)  plot(ergm_gof, statistic = "espart")

what: Easily graph networks with sensible defaults — plot_graphr
title: Easily graph networks with sensible defaults — plot_graphr
text: function provides users easy way graph (m)network data exploration, investigation, inspiration, communication. builds upon {ggplot2} {ggraph} offer pretty extensible graphing solutions. However, compared solutions, graphr() contains various algorithms provide better looking graphs default. means just passing function network data often sufficient return reasonable-looking graph. function also makes easy modify many commonly adapted aspects graph, including node edge size, colour, shape, arguments rather additional functions need remember. can defined outright, e.g. node_size = 8, reference attribute network, e.g. node_size = "wealth". Lastly, graphr() uses {ggplot2}-related theme information, easy make colour palette fonts institution-specific consistent. See e.g. theme_iheid() . learn can done visually, try run_tute("Visualisation").

title: Easily graph networks with sensible defaults — plot_graphr
code: graphr(   .data,   layout,   labels = TRUE,   node_color,   node_shape,   node_size,   node_group,   edge_color,   edge_size,   snap = FALSE,   ...,   node_colour,   edge_colour )

title: Easily graph networks with sensible defaults — plot_graphr
text: .data manynet-consistent object. layout igraph, ggraph, manynet layout algorithm. declared, defaults "triad" networks 3 nodes, "quad" networks 4 nodes, "stress" one mode networks, "hierarchy" two mode networks. "hierarchy" layout, one can split graph declaring "center" argument "events", "actors", declaring node name. "concentric" layout algorithm please declare "membership" extra argument. "membership" argument expects either quoted node attribute present data vector length nodes draw concentric circles. "multilevel" layout algorithm please declare "level" extra argument. "level" argument expects either quoted node attribute present data vector length nodes hierarchically order categories. "level" missing, function look 'lvl' node attribute data. "lineage" layout ranks nodes Y axis according values. "lineage" layout algorithm please declare "rank" extra argument. "rank" argument expects either quoted node attribute present data vector length nodes. labels Logical, whether print node names labels present. node_color, node_colour Node variable used coloring nodes. easiest added node attribute graph plotting. Nodes can also colored declaring color instead. node_shape Node variable used shaping nodes. easiest added node attribute graph plotting. Nodes can also shaped declaring shape instead. node_size Node variable used sizing nodes. can continuous variable nodes network. Since function expects existing variable, recommended calculate node-related statistics prior using function. Nodes can also sized declaring numeric size vector instead. node_group Node variable used grouping nodes. easiest added hull groups plotting. Group variables minimum 3 nodes, less, number groups reduced merging categories lower counts one called "". edge_color, edge_colour Tie variable used coloring nodes. easiest added edge tie attribute graph plotting. Edges can also colored declaring color instead. edge_size Tie variable used sizing edges. can continuous variable nodes network. Since function expects existing variable, recommended calculate edge-related statistics prior using function. Edges can also sized declaring numeric size vector instead. snap Logical scalar, whether layout snapped grid. ... Extra arguments pass layout algorithm, necessary.

title: Easily graph networks with sensible defaults — plot_graphr
text: ggplot2::ggplot() object. last plot can saved file system using ggplot2::ggsave().

title: Matching colors across palettes — theme_match
text: Sometimes palette particular colours chosen symbolise represent particular idea, red "stop" green "go", convey interpretation. Yet institutional palettes necessarily include colours, can constrain interpretable visualisations institutional branding requirements. match_color() helps find closest matching colours given palette one input colours. also helper function, is_dark(), determine whether color dark light, can useful deciding whether use white black text top colored background.

title: Matching colors across palettes — theme_match

title: Matching colors across palettes — theme_match

what: Setting a consistent theme for all plots — theme_set
title: Setting a consistent theme for all plots — theme_set
text: function enables plots quickly, easily consistently themed. achieved setting theme option, usually start R session, enables palette used autograph-consistent plotting methods. includes thematic colours backgrounds, highlights, sequential, divergent categorical colour schemes. function sets palettes options used various plotting functions. theme specified (.e. function called without argument), current theme reported. default theme "default". theme uses white background, blue red highlighting, blue-white-red divergent palette. themes can changed time calling stocnet_theme() alias set_stocnet_theme() different theme name. themes include based colour schemes various universities, including ETH Zurich, UZH, UNIBE, RUG, Oxford. themes include "bw" black white, "crisp" high-contrast black white theme, "neon" dark theme neon highlights, "rainbow" colourful theme. themes designed colour-blind safe.

title: Setting a consistent theme for all plots — theme_set
code: stocnet_theme(theme = NULL)  set_stocnet_theme(theme = NULL)

title: Setting a consistent theme for all plots — theme_set
text: theme String naming theme. default "default". following themes currently available: default, bw, crisp, neon, iheid, ethz, uzh, rug, unibe, oxf, unige, cmu, rainbow. string can capitalised .

title: autograph 0.4.0
text: Fixed DOI CITATION Improved README introduction Improved README graphing illustration, including igraph comparison figure Improved README plotting illustration, added SAOM/ERGM GOF comparison figure

title: autograph 0.4.0
text: Improved stocnet_theme() documentation vector potential fonts included themes first font found system used, user notified fonts found, default R font (“sans”) used message printed inform user default used, install missing fonts via {extrafont} Added font options “iheid”, “oxf”, “ethz”, “uzh”, “rug” themes Added ag_font() retrieving registered font family Improved match_colors() documentation Exported is_dark() made vectorised Added match_colors() is_dark() tests Dropped theme_*() functions favour stocnet_theme() Dropped theme_*() tests Added stocnet_theme() tests Added “cmu” theme Carnegie Mellon University

title: autograph 0.4.0
text: Improved graphr() using registered fonts available Improved graphr() using ag_qualitative() discrete colour scales

title: autograph 0.4.0
text: Improved plot.selectionTable() plot.influenceTable() documentation consolidating together one help file Improved plot.ag_conv(), plot.ag_gof(), plot_interp using registered fonts available Improved plot.sienaGOF() use lower case auxiliary statistic description

title: autograph 0.4.0
